column4: - ksudo user-admin in a termianl - first time: enter pw, dialog closes, return to $ prompt.  try again - no dialog, get "er may not run gksudo on localhost" on term.  (sttdout/err)
- oh crap.  i forgot that my user isn't in suduers yet.  damm preseed install.  I keep meaning to fix that...
- so yes, sudo works as expected.  look like gksudo is dropping some chars or something and not reporting problems quite right
ah, ok :-) well, then your bug report should be that gksudo doesn't print a meaningful error message
right; bug report appreciated :-) against gksudo
- glad we met in devle or this wouldhave been one misleading bugzilla.  (may want to get m to reconsider where bug reports are discussed)
oh, discussing and reassigning in bz is fine, too
- it has in the past, but I just got shooed out ;)
in general, I consider a small message "Can someone please help me with a bug in #u" on #u-d just fine
- i try to keep my interaction with bz to a minimum
wouldn't help, a person can only read a limited number of channels
